summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of Corrections Officer IMMAGEILI at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) regarding the circumstances surrounding the death of Jeffrey Epstein. The officer describes his shift, the cell counts, and his interactions with Epstein, and expresses shock at the incident. The interview was conducted as part of an ongoing criminal investigation.

persons.name: IMMAGEILI
persons.role: Corrections Officer at Bureau of Prisons (BOP) Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC)
persons.context: Interviewed by FBI and OIG regarding the night Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell. He was working an overtime shift in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and described the cell count procedures.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who was found unresponsive in his cell at MCC. IMMAGEILI stated he once fed him, that Epstein was grateful, did not appear dangerous, and never offered him money.

persons.name: NOEL
persons.context: Assisted IMMAGEILI with the 3am and 5am inmate counts in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) on the shift when Epstein was found.

persons.name: THOMAS
persons.context: Relieved IMMAGEILI at some point during his shift to give him a break.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: Came by to check on IMMAGEILI at some point during his shift, though the exact time was not remembered.

connections.description: IMMAGEILI was the corrections officer on duty in Epstein's unit. He once fed Epstein because Epstein had not received his meal, and stated Epstein was grateful.
NOEL assisted IMMAGEILI with the 3am and 5am inmate counts in the Special Housing Unit.
Officer THOMAS relieved IMMAGEILI during his shift to give him a break.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein found unresponsive
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. The exact date is not specified in the document, but the officer recalls it was the previous Saturday, which based on the interview date of 08/16/2019, would be 08/10/2019.

events.title: FBI/OIG interview of Corrections Officer
events.description: FBI Special Agents and an OIG SA interviewed Corrections Officer IMMAGEILI regarding the circumstances of Jeffrey Epstein's death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, New York
United States Attorneys Office, Southern District of New York (SDNY), 1 St. Andrews Plaza, New York, New York
keyFacts: Corrections Officer IMMAGEILI was working a 12am-8am overtime shift in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) when Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell.
IMMAGEILI stated that for the 3am and 5am counts, he requested assistance from Officer NOEL because there should always be a double staff count and he would not do a count without a partner.
IMMAGEILI expressed shock at Epstein's death, stating Epstein was supposed to be watched more closely and rounds should have been conducted regardless of previous suicide watch status.
At the end of the interview, IMMAGEILI voluntarily stated, "I want to be clear, I never brought stuff into the jail or allowed stuff in. I never did that."
The interview was part of an ongoing criminal investigation, and the officer was advised of his obligation to answer truthfully.
